intro: Brachyloma saxicola, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a small, flowering plant native to southern Australia. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white, usually during the spring or early summer. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in its harsh habitat. Brachyloma saxicola is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
